metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6123 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Chicken before 4.8.0 does not properly handle NUL bytes in certain strings,which allows an attacker to conduct "poisoned NUL byte attack."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.8.0-1
libchicken7 - 4.8.0-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chicken package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-1').
